title: Lol patcher not downloading  files at all (plus a prior "weirdly solved" issue....)
body:
First had issue that stopped me playing League back when the new interface came out in its patch.... firstly when the logo pops up the 2nd time with the gray bar until I found a fix (found it today) it would crash instead of downloading and proceeding to the patcher (the fix involved holding Caps lock as soon as the 2nd icon popped up... no Idea why it worked)....

So now the present issue... 
Now the present issue....it gets to the patcher and proceeds to scan what files need updating, then starts showing the speed of download (at around 300 or 80)... this speed slow drops down to 0 kb/s, in the mean time no files appear to be downloaded...

would love to get some help...

(tried turning off firewall already... and had tried all the random methods to solve the first issue...although they could work for the 2nd.. would just would appreciate more accurate direction)

thank you in advance for any help! 
Smurfelicious

replies.body:
I had that exact problem! It is most definitely the fault of the new patcher, and the way it handles downloads. I found a quick solution, and that is to use a VPN when downloading the patch. Of course, this solution sucks as you'll most likely have to fork out some money for that, so I have another way. [Set your DNS address manually.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jwq4) The new patcher doesn't like automatically set ones for some reason. Should work fine after this.

Be warned though, it could affect other programs. Be ready to set it back. Best of luck!

unfortunately that didn't work...thank you for the suggestion though...

any other ideas?
(as in tried the dns part..to clarify)

You still get the exact same error? Are you sure that you clicked the right internet adapter and clicked "Apply"?

Very strange, this just outright fixed all connection issues I had with League. What OS are you using? How are you connected to the internet?

Thanks for replying

yep.. definitely

Also ended up using a free vpn.... still didn't work..

windows 7, I don't know the technical details to well.. but connected through the wire (ethernet cable?) that goes to a power circuit that connects to my modem.... however I didn't have any issues with this setup prior to the update for the new interface.....

any other ideas?

Sorry about the late response, but the boards wouldn't let me sign in for some reason for a few days.

I forgot to mention that you should flush your DNS and then reset your computer. In Windows, open your command prompt (Ctrl+R and then type cmd.exe) and then type in "ipconfig /flushdns" without quotations and then reset your computer.

If that doesn't work and you really need to get on League, you can try connecting your computer to another internet source, be it your smart phone's hotspot or a connection at a friend's place. Alternatively, you could find a computer which has the latest version installed and copy the RAD files from that one to yours.

But I think you'd want this fixed. Try testing your connection on this http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/ and tell me anything that comes up orange (or red).

Best of luck.

Thanks for replying... I'll try them out when I get a chance

(on holiday atm... which turns out is a good opportunity to test the internet connection)

Thanks again
ok so going off a wireless connection at the hotel I'm staying at didn't work still at 0kb/s

That just makes me think it's your computer specifically then, not your connection, meaning the flushing of DNS should work. Or it could just mean that the hotel has the same problem; I don't think a business like that would be too concerned whether or not you can update League on their connection or not.

okay, so tried flushing the dns.... didn't work..

Just did the test.. here are the red and orange results

"Red (major abnormalities)
 Netalyzr's bandwidth test may have disrupted your network  
A detected in-network HTTP cache incorrectly caches information 
Orange (Minor abnormalities)
Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic 
We detected at least one proxy  
We detected an HTTP proxy due to flow content changes 
Content filters or compression proxies appear to be present in the network 
A detected in-network HTTP cache exists in your network 

here is what I assume is the finer details of the red and orange

Direct TCP connections to remote SMTP/SSL servers (port 465) succeed, but do not receive the expected content.
The client received an empty response instead of our normal banner. This suggests that a firewall, proxy, or filter initially allowed the connection and then terminated it, either because it did not understand our server's reply or decided to block the service.
Direct TCP connections to remote IMAP/SSL servers (port 993) succeed, but do not receive the expected content.
The client received an empty response instead of our normal banner. This suggests that a firewall, proxy, or filter initially allowed the connection and then terminated it, either because it did not understand our server's reply or decided to block the service.
Direct TCP connections to remote POP/SSL servers (port 995) succeed, but do not receive the expected content.
The client received an empty response instead of our normal banner. This suggests that a firewall, proxy, or filter initially allowed the connection and then terminated it, either because it did not understand our server's reply or decided to block the service.
Hidden Proxy Detection (?): Warning –
Netalyzr detected the following proxies:
Port: 25 , Response Time: 6 ms
Port: 110 (POP3), Response Time: 7 ms
Port: 143 (IMAP), Response Time: 7 ms
Port: 465 (SMTP/SSL), Response Time: 7 ms
Port: 587 (Authenticated SMTP), Response Time: 8 ms
Port: 993 (IMAP/SSL), Response Time: 6 ms
Port: 995 (POP/SSL), Response Time: 7 ms
Netalyzr experienced transient difficulties when uploading test results. The most common cause of this problem is poorly designed home network equipment which crashes as a consequence of Netalyzr's bandwidth test.
Content-based HTTP proxy detection (?): Warning –
Changes to headers or contents sent between the client and our HTTP server show the presence of an otherwise unadvertised HTTP proxy.
The following headers had their capitalization modified by the proxy:
Content-Length: 681
The following headers were added by the proxy to HTTP responses:
Expires: [Mon, 26 Jul 1997 05:00:00 GMT]
Cache-Expires: [Mon, 26 Jul 1997 05:00:00 GMT]
The detected proxy reordered the headers sent from the server.
Files of type exe are blocked by the network.
HTTP caching behavior (?): Warning –
One of the test images could not be downloaded."

For future reference, logs that are that huge should be included as an attachment to the message.

But anyway,

did you do this test with all other applications closed in the background and without the use of a vpn? That may have caused the red message. Additionally it seems like your firewall is doing work on not letting certain applications communicate data outwards.

Or it could just be faulty wiring at some point in your connection.

Anyway, this means that it'll be really hard to get this working. What I suggest you do is find someone who already has installed the patch, and just copy their files from folder "project" over to yours.

If you want to try, bring up Internet Explorer, reset its settings and set its security level to "Low".

Do tell what you end up doing.

yep will do.

I believe so, there may have been other people using the network at the time though.

Firewall I've checked the outbound rules non that seem to relate to League are blocked...

well one would assume since I tried on the hotels wifi that this might not be the right direction....

Tried the internet explorer one (although doesn't let you set it too low only medium)

as for copying, well I guess the test I would need to do is see if I can download it on to another computer who uses the network then either see if that works and potentially move the files over...

Well, my objective is to get League running on *your* computer. If you're able to able to able to grab the files, you should be fine. And btw, the only files you need are the ones in the 'project' folder inside 'RADS'.

Also, backup up your 'Config' folder and [backup up your item sets](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752904-Getting-Started-with-Item-Sets-#h4).

One last note, use the default install path. Weird things like that may have been the original cause.

If it's still not working, don't hesitate to reply to this message. I'll be glad to help.

Thanks

although I had tried uninstalling and deleting everything so It's pretty much a fresh install. So I will try to install then transfer from another computer when i get the chance.

Thanks for all the help, really appreciate it.
